html:
Introduction

After the threatenings of wrath in the foregoing chapter we have here, I. Thankful praises for what God had done, which the prophet, in the name of the church, offers up to God, and teaches us to offer the like, Isaiah 25:1-5. II. Precious promises of what God would yet further do for his church, especially in the grace of the gospel, Isaiah 25:6-8. III. The church's triumph in God over her enemies thereupon, Isaiah 25:9-12. This chapter looks as pleasantly upon the church as the former looked dreadfully upon the world.
